Operations Management.Description: Examines strategic, tactical and operational issues in the planning and control of manufacturing and service delivery systems.  This course examines such topics as process design, capacity and materials planning and control, inventory management, facility layout, quality and work management.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Proficiency in ERP systems such as SAP
Understanding of inventory and supply chain management
Data analysis for process optimization
Application of lean manufacturing principles
Knowledge of facility layout and production planning
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Effective communication with teams and stakeholders
Collaboration in cross-functional environments
Building relationships in supplier and customer networks
Presentation of operational data and insights
Facilitating discussions on operational improvements
ProblemSolvingAndAnalyticalSkills: Critical thinking in process design and optimization
Analyzing materials and capacity planning issues
Developing solutions for quality management challenges
Troubleshooting operational bottlenecks
Evaluating supply chain sustainability strategies
OrganizationalAndLeadershipSkills: Leadership in operations and supply chain teams

Operations & Supply Chain Management.Description: This course focuses on the issues related to process, layout, production planning, materials management, quality, and lean manufacturing.  The effects of these issues on productivity, firm performance, and customer satisfaction will be discussed.  Furthermore, supply chain design, integration, and sustainability are discussed and analyzed.
